The photo collage was published on Faceb: 2016, and has been shared over 22,000 times.
The misleading Facebook post included a: language caption that translates to English as: "In Kashmir, a cow is slaughtered on the top of the Indian tricolour. Now the Indian leaders will express their sorrow only. Brothers, if you have had the milk of holy cow mother, then swear on that cow milk, you have to spread this photo everywhere in India to pay the debt of that cow milk. And yes only a fundamentalist Hindu will share this."
The same photo collage was shared on Fac: 4. A reverse image search on Google revealed that all four images in the photo collage were taken from separate incidents of clashes between activists and policemen in India and Pakistan.
